meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Amy Sumner Sam Oglesby Kirstin Cutts Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7476.

td.p: Amy Sumner, an attorney from Denver, Colorado
Sam Oglesby, a software support rep from Wilmington, Massachusetts
Kirstin Cutts, a graduate student from Austin, Texas (whose 3-day cash winnings total $41,202)

tr.td: PIZZA
GIMME A SLICE
CEMETERIES
LEAD SINGERS FOR THE BAND
IN ABSENTIA
(Alex: ....each correct response will be formed from some of the letters, the eight letters in the word "absentia".)

td.a: THE NATIONAL MUSEUM OF AFRICAN AMERICAN HISTORY & CULTURE

tr.td: (Alex: A return visit because there was so much to see.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'The pizza seen here displays the colors of the Italian flag with green mainly provided by this herb')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: The pizza seen here displays the colors of the Italian flag with green mainly provided by this herb

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_1', 'clue_J_6_1_stuck', '(Alex gives the clue from the Nat\'l Museum of African American History & Culture in Washington, D.C.) Dismantled at its original location on Edisto Island, South Carolina, & now restored & a centerpiece of the museum, this cabin dates back to the early days of slavery but was used well into the 20th century, with residents picking as much as 100 pounds a day of this crop')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Alex gives the clue from the Nat'l Museum of African American History & Culture in Washington, D.C.) Dismantled at its original location on Edisto Island, South Carolina, & now restored & a centerpiece of the museum, this cabin dates back to the early days of slavery but was used well into the 20th century, with residents picking as much as 100 pounds a day of this crop
